column1: BBC News NI outlines the latest data on coronavirus and Covid-19 vaccinations across Northern Ireland and the Republic of Ireland.Four Covid-19-related deaths have been reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday. Deaths are measured by recording those who died within 28 days of receiving a positive result in a test for coronavirus.  The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in Northern Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 2
column3: 931 new cases of coronavirus were reported in Northern Ireland on Wednesday
column5: 476 on Tuesday.That includes cases confirmed from samples taken in recent days
column6: not necessarily just in the latest 24-hour reporting period.There are currently 386 Covid inpatients in hospitals across Northern Ireland
column7: down from 390 on Tuesday.There are 36 being treated in intensive care units (ICU)
column8: up from 33 on Tuesday.Hospital occupancy is sitting at 105%. Last updated 24 November at 14:15 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandA total of 2
column10: 297 vaccines for Covid-19 have been administered in Northern Ireland as of Wednesday.1
column12: 404 of the jabs were first doses
column16: 847 were third doses of the vaccine. The remainder were booster jabs. Last updated 24 November at 14:15 GMTSource: Department of Health Northern IrelandAnother 3
column17: 893 cases of coronavirus were reported in the Republic of Ireland on Wednesday
column19: 666 on Tuesday.The total number of deaths linked to Covid-19 in the Republic of Ireland since the start of the pandemic is 5
